channel.title: Comments on: Silverlight Game Programming: Playing an Audio File

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/577/comment-page-1#comment-3220">Nate DeHaven</a>.
No idea. Never considered SL great for games anyway.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Nate DeHaven.

No idea. Never considered SL great for games anyway.

item.title: By: Nate DeHaven
item.dc:creator: Nate DeHaven
item.description: This is a good tut. My question is - in the world of increasingly online-based games, and with MS's online division hemorrhaging hundreds of millions per quarter, how long will SL be relevant for game programming?
item.content:encoded: This is a good tut. My question is – in the world of increasingly online-based games, and with MS’s online division hemorrhaging hundreds of millions per quarter, how long will SL be relevant for game programming?

item.title: By: zproxy
item.dc:creator: zproxy
item.description: Do you know how to play a sound from a stream, from an embedded resource? In flash that's really easy, yet I have found that feature in WPF/silverlight.
item.content:encoded: Do you know how to play a sound from a stream, from an embedded resource? In flash that’s really easy, yet I have found that feature in WPF/silverlight.
